topdown

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • topdown.GameObject
      • topdown.Player

  • public class Player
extends GameObject
    Class used to create the player GameObject and alter its properties.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Isaac Jimenez, Nicholas English, Suman Gurung

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int x, int y, Type type, Handler handle, Game game)
      Constructor creates a player object by accepting in various parameters needed to determine the properties of the player.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns the boundaries of the player.
      int getHealth()
      Returns an int that represents the current health of the player.
      int getMoney()
      Returns the amount of money the player currently has.
      int getOverShield()
      Returns the amount of shield the player currently has.
      void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draws the player with the given bounds.
      void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the health for the player object to the amount passed.
      void setMoney(int money)
      Sets the amount of money the player has.
      void setOverShield(int overShield)
      Sets the amount of shield the player has.
      void tick()
      Continuously updates the player's position, and checks to see if the player has collided with an enemy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
              int y,
              Type type,
              Handler handle,
              Game game)
        Constructor creates a player object by accepting in various parameters needed to determine the properties of the player.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the x coordinate at which the player will spawn.
        y - represents the y coordinate at which the player will spawn.
        type - represents the type of object.
        handle - represents the instance of the Handler class being passed down to this constructor.
        game - represents the instance of the Game class being passed down to this constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Continuously updates the player's position, and checks to see if the player has collided with an enemy.
        Specified by:
        tick in class GameObject

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the player with the given bounds.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        g - visual display for the 2D graphics.

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        Returns the boundaries of the player.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The boundaries of the player as a rectangle.

      • getHealth

        public int getHealth()
        Returns an int that represents the current health of the player.
        Returns:
        The health of the current player.

      • setHealth

      • getOverShield
